value.title: Indonesia sets sights on artificial intelligence in new national strategy
value.excerpt: The government has introduced a national strategy for developing artificial intelligence, but experts are calling for assurances that progress in this high-tech field is safe and beneficial for all.

value.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator developer Q&A addresses top community questions and concerns
value.excerpt: With five days to go until Microsoft Flight Simulator's official PC release, the last development update before the event has now been made available, bringing news on even more deliverables.

value.title: Amazon EC2 Inf1 instances featuring AWS Inferentia chips now available in five new Regions and with improved performance
value.excerpt: Following strong customer demand, AWS has expanded the availability of Amazon EC2 Inf1 instances to five new Regions: US East (Ohio), Asia Pacific (Sydney, Tokyo), and Europe (Frankfurt, Ireland). Inf1 instances are powered by AWS Inferentia chips, which Amazon custom-designed to provide you with the

value.title: Microsoft will now let you choose a preferred GPU for every Windows 10 app
value.excerpt: Windows 10 allows users to choose a GPU for performance-demanding workloads and a GPU for light workloads to save power, which is good enough for notebooks that have an integrated GPU and a standalone graphics processor.

value.title: Healthcare provider and payer execs point to AI, robotics as next industry disruptors: report
value.excerpt: Nearly half of healthcare provider and payer executives (45 percent) believe that rapid advancements in new tech and innovations will disrupt the healthcare industry, according to an Aug. 11 Accenture report.

value.title: Artificial intelligence warning: AI will know us better than we know ourselves
value.excerpt: ARTIFICIAL Intelligence (AI) is a totalitarian's dream and will have the potential to know you better than you know yourself, a researcher has claimed.

value.title: Blaize AI: Now In Production And Trials

value.title: Amazon launches Braket quantum computing service in general availability
value.excerpt: Amazon today launched its fully managed quantum computing service -- Braket -- in general availability following a preview.

value.title: Self-driving car only lanes? They're coming to an autonomous corridor in Michigan
value.excerpt: A new public-private endeavor will see a 40-mile stretch between Detroit and Ann Arbor outfitted with dedicated lanes for autonomous vehicles.

value.title: AI researchers devise cheap data collection method to scale training robots
value.excerpt: Researchers used a GoPro camera and a reacher-grabber device to gather robotic training data, a cheap approach that could someday improve home robots.

value.title: Miso Robotics brings in new CEO to automate restaurant kitchens
value.excerpt: Flippy the kitchen robot has a new boss. Miso Robotics Inc., the Pasadena, California-based startup that's automating restaurant kitchens, has tapped Mike Bell to serve as CEO. Company co-founder and former CEO Buck Jordan will focus on raising money as president and chairman of the board.

value.title: Pro-China Propaganda Act Used Fake Followers Made With AI-Generated Images
value.excerpt: China propaganda campaign on social media has been creating fake followers with the help of AI-generated images of seemingly real, but fictitious people.

value.title: IBM launches three free AI-focused online learning platforms for young people and their teachers
value.excerpt: Teachers working with younger students in the K-8 range can use IBM's Teacher Advisor with Watson to better plan lessons that meet the individual needs of their students. Rather than teaching particular AI-based skills and information about emerging ...

value.title: Root AI raises $7.2M seed round to deploy its harvesting robot amid COVID-19-fueled demand
value.excerpt: By all accounts, the COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the adoption of robotics and automation by months, if not years. The reasons are fairly clear — robotics don’t call in sick, nor are they disease vectors in the same manner as their human counterparts.

value.title: Book Review – “Turning Point”, An Excellent Introduction To Policy Issues Involving Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Turning Point” is an excellent book that decision makers can use as a tutorial to understand the growing importance of policy related to AI, policy in both the public and private sectors.

value.title: Future of farming: AI-enabled harvest robot flexes new dexterity skills
value.excerpt: Now that Root AI's robot has mastered the art of picking oblong vegetables as well as oblate shaped berries, could this technology help enhance global food security?

value.title: How the pandemic is influencing robotics research
value.excerpt: The pandemic makes physical experimentation with robots practically impossible. Here's how some roboticists have adjusted to the new normal.

value.title: Intel Xe-HPG: gaming GPU with ray tracing tech and GDDR6 ships in 2021
value.excerpt: Intel announces new Xe microarchitecture variant: Xe-HPG -- a gaming-optimized GPU with ray tracing and GDDR6 memory ships in 2021.

value.title: The newest fintech unicorn is a credit card, and it's betting against big banks
value.excerpt: Musician John Legend and former AOL CEO Tim Armstrong are among the big money backers behind credit.ai, a new fintech banking and credit platform, including its Unicorn Card, designed for millennials distrustful of big banks.

value.title: How to protect AI systems against image-scaling attacks
value.excerpt: We usually don’t expect the image of a teacup to turn into a cat when we zoom out. But in the world of artificial intelligence research, strange things can happen. value.title: Does AI Make More Reliable Financial Recommendations Than Humans?
value.excerpt: As beneficial as AI can be, companies in financial services need to keep one very important reality in mind: Consumers don’t trust it (yet).

value.title: MLops: The rise of machine learning operations
value.excerpt: Once machine learning models make it to production, they still need updates and monitoring for drift. A team to manage ML operations makes good business sense

value.title: Singapore parks $182M for fintech innovation, with special focus on AI
value.excerpt: Country rolls out new three-year plan with SG$250 million ($182.1 million) investment to drive technology innovation in the financial services industry, which saw 40 innovation labs and 1,000 fintech companies set up in the last five years.

value.title: Microsoft trains AI agents for more realistic gaming
value.excerpt: Microsoft's Project Padia is all about teaching AI agents to enhance your gaming experience. This time, they ar teaching NPC to cooperate with humans.

value.title: Inside Track: COVID-19 Is Forcing Corporate Legal Departments to Spend More on Outside Counsel
value.excerpt: Recent surveys found in-house counsel are spending more on outside counsel to handle mostly urgent and unplanned matters connected to the novel coronavirus. Also, the pandemic has created so many changes that may be hitting legal departments at unexpected angles.

value.title: Amazon Textract now available in Asia Pacific (Mumbai) and EU (Frankfurt) Regions
value.excerpt: You can now use Amazon Textract, a machine learning (ML) service that quickly and easily extracts text and data from forms and tables in scanned documents, for workloads in the AWS Asia Pacific (Mumbai) and EU (Frankfurt) Regions. Amazon Textract goes beyond simple optical character recognition (OCR)
